Boston.com
10

Romney says he paid 13% tax rate for last 10 years

Mitt Romney said his federal tax rate was 13 percent in each of the last 10 years, but he declined to release the tax returns to confirm his claim. "I paid taxes every single year,” he said. (Boston Globe)
  • In 2010, Ryan denied making appeals for federal funds
  • Romney, Ryan to hold town hall meeting Monday in N.H.
  • Pictures Campaign trail | Watch Campaign ads

Human-biting EEE-infected mosquitos found in Westborough and New Bedford

As a result of the latest findings, health officials have raised the EEE threat level to “high” in these two communities. (Boston Globe)

Highest paid Mass. hospital executives

Chief executives of the area's numerous hospitals earned up to $3.1 million each.Take a closer look at the compensation of the highest paid executives.

Facebook stock plunges to new low

A ban expired today that had prevented some early investors and insiders from dumping millions of additional shares they own. (AP)
  • When Facebook insiders, employees can sell stock
  • Investors who sold stock in Facebook IPO
  • Track Facebook stock on our Markets page

Hundreds greet Raisman in Burlington

Olympic gold medalist Aly Raisman signed autographs and posed for pictures at her Burlington gym today. (Boston Globe)
  • Congratulate Raisman | Pictures Raisman's return
  • Watch Big Story: Raisman's fans welcome her home
  • Judo medal winner Harrison of Marblehead on tour

Male birth control pill? One lab says yes

Dana-Farber scientists found that by injecting mice with a compound, they could decrease the number of sperm and its ability to move, rendering male mice infertile. (Boston Globe)

Obama's push yields few new voters

President Obama's campaign has invested heavily in grassroots infrastructure, but voter registration trends show scant evidence the effort is paying off.

Parents fearing for daughters

Any intervention in Syria would have to be led and financed by the US.

News

South African police open fire
and kill striking miners

The officers opened fire on a crowd of striking miners that charged a line of officers, killing some and wounding others in one of the worst shootings by authorities since the apartheid era.

Obama leads Romney among voters not likely to vote

A USA Today/Suffolk University poll shows President Obama leads his Mitt Romney by a wide margin among registered voters who say they probably won't cast ballots this fall.
